items.text: I'm a temporary research fellow at the Institute of Informatics and Telematics (IIT) of the National Research Council (CNR) working in a group called Web Applications for the Future Internet (WAFI). In the mean time I'm a third year Ph.D. student in Information Engineering at the University of Pisa. My research interests are mainly focused on Web technologies, Semantic Web, Linked Data and Information Visualization.

DoGi
items.description: DoGi is a database containing bibliographic references of articles published on italian juridical journals. The DoGi project consists in the translation of this relational database with Semantic Web Technologies. Moreover, Information Visualization techniques have been used in order to present the dataset.

items.name: Smartarea
items.description: The activity performed in the Smartarea project consists in the design and development of a 3D-interactive map built using Three.js that allows to find places and get directions within the CNR campus in Pisa.

items.name: ASIA
items.description: ASIA is a project focused on the collection and analysis of web information about people and commercial activities. Once data is retrieved from the web, it is used to enrich people and commercial activities profiles in order to highlight tax evasion anomalies.
